Painter Sarvesh says he wants "to make people aware of the sacrifice of defence personnel" and started the project two years ago. Sarvesh said he currently works as a labourer and tries to save money to put into pending work.

176.title: EPFO adds 18.23 lakh subscribers in July, posts 24% YoY rise
176.article_body: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) added 18.23 lakh net subscribers in July 2022, marking an increase of over 24% as compared to the year-ago period, Labour Ministry data showed. Of the total additions, around 10.58 lakh members joined EPFO's social security ambit for the first time. About 57.69% of the new subscribers are from the age-group of 18-25 years.

177.title: Hurts to see media pick up adverse global comments on India: Dhankhar
177.article_body: Vice-President (VP) Jagdeep Dhankhar said it "pains" his heart when the media picks up, in "high decibel", adverse comments made against India by someone disconnected from ground reality. "That kind of politics has to be contained," said Dhankhar. He added that India had never received so much global attention and the image of Indians abroad is a matter of pride.

178.title: Ambala court sentences man to 20 years in prison for raping minor
178.article_body: A man was handed a 20-year prison sentence by a fast track court in Haryana's Ambala on Tuesday for raping a 14-year-old girl. According to the prosecution, the convict came to the victim's house in April 2020 while her parents were away and gave her chocolate to eat, after which she fell asleep. The 24-year-old man then raped the minor.

179.title: Raj CM calls late-night meeting of Congress MLAs ahead of party's Prez polls
179.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has called a late-night meeting of Congress MLAs at 10 pm on Tuesday ahead of the party's Presidential polls. "Meeting's agenda isn't clear," a cabinet minister of Rajasthan government said. Gehlot, who is scheduled to travel to Kerala on Wednesday to join 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', is likely to file nomination for the polls between September 24-28.

180.title: Odisha college student beaten by brother for ignoring studies, dies
180.article_body: A 21-year-old college student in Odisha's Bhubaneswar was allegedly thrashed to death by his elder brother for neglecting his studies and leading a "lavish lifestyle", police said on Tuesday. The elder brother, who was reprimanding the student, picked up an iron pipe and beat him up when he didn't listen. The accused was arrested on Tuesday after police got information.

181.title: Film industry was praying for 'Brahmastra' to do well: Alia Bhatt
181.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that everyone in the film industry wanted her film 'Brahmastra' to do well at the box office. "I don't think I have ever gotten so many 'all the best' messages before a film...That spirit of the industry even before the release was very special to witness," she further added. The film also featured Ranbir Kapoor.

182.title: Argentina sees shortage of football WC stickers; fans call it 'frustrating'
182.article_body: The convenience stores in Argentina have reportedly run out of stocks of football World Cup stickers that have become quite popular among the citizens. According to Reuters, the craze has led to the creation of an app that allows fans to track the availability of stickers. "It's frustrating," a resident said as fresh stocks are getting sold out within hours.

183.title: Odisha woman falls off bike as saree gets entangled in wheel, dies
183.article_body: A woman fell off a moving motorbike after her saree got entangled in the rear wheel of the two-wheeler in Odisha on Tuesday. The woman, Geetanjali Rana, died due to severe head injuries. A man named Judhisthir Rana was driving the bike with his wife Santoshini and Geetanjali riding pillion when the accident happened. Judhisthir and Santoshini sustained critical injuries.

184.title: Fintech sector needs to work relentlessly on safety, reliability: PM
184.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the fintech industry needs to work relentlessly on safety and reliability to uphold trust of the people. "Rapid, relentless and proactive work in ensuring security, safety and reliability is important to uphold the enormous trust that the people have placed," he said. PM Modi said this in his message at the Global Fintech Fest.

185.title: He frees his mind and strike rate is natural outcome: Harsha on Rahul's 55(35)
185.article_body: Commenting on India opener KL Rahul's strike rate of 157.14 during his 35-ball 55 in the first T20I against Australia in Mohali, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "So, you see, KL Rahul doesn't have to worry about, or think of, strike rates." He added, "He frees his mind and the strike rate is the natural outcome."

186.title: Didn't have a permanent house when I was growing up: Shefali Shah
186.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah revealed she did not have a permanent house while growing up as her father's job at RBI wasn't permanent yet. "There were times when he would request my uncle or someone to let me and my mom stay there," she stated. Shefali added she later lived in a 'kholi' in Mahim with her parents, uncle and aunt.

187.title: UPI aims to process 1 bn transactions a day in 5 years: Sitharaman
187.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that Unified Payments Interface (UPI) has set a target to process one billion transactions a day in the next five years. She said the country is witnessing substantial growth in UPI transactions on monthly basis. Notably, about 6.28 billion UPI transactions worth over ₹10.62 lakh crore took place in July.

188.title: Violent protests in Bengal after child's body found in neighbour's house
188.article_body: People burnt a vehicle during a protest after the body of a missing child was reportedly recovered in his neighbour's house in West Bengal's Santiniketan. Police have detained the accused woman and appealed to villagers to maintain peace, the Birbhum Superintendent of Police said. The boy went missing on Sunday when he went to buy biscuits from a shop.

189.title: India record their highest-ever total against Australia in T20I cricket
189.article_body: India put up a total of 208/6 in their 20 overs against Australia in the first T20I today. It's India's highest total against Australia in T20I cricket. India's previous highest T20I total against Australia had come on October 10, 2013, when they registered 202/4. It's the third time India have aggregated a T20I total of 200 or more against Australia.

190.title: 25-yr-old Cong worker uploads pro-Pakistan post online, arrested
190.article_body: A 25-year-old Congress worker was arrested on Monday in the Laksar area of Haridwar for allegedly uploading a 'Pakistan Zindabad' poster on social media, police said on Tuesday. During questioning, the accused told the police that he had uploaded a poster and added the slogan by mistake, a police official said. A complaint was registered after the post went viral.

191.title: Ireland to increase state pension for those who work beyond 66
191.article_body: Ireland's cabinet has approved a reform in the country's pension scheme under which anyone choosing to work beyond the age of 66 will receive a higher state pension. From 2024, people will have the option to work until 70 years of age. For each year they work beyond 66, there will be an increment in their pension.

192.title: Belittled police: Ex-IPS officers to Prez on Kejriwal's Gujarat visit
192.article_body: Thirty former IPS officers have written a letter to President Droupadi Murmu, accusing Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of "belittling" police officers during his recent visit to Gujarat. While campaigning for the coming elections in the state, Kejriwal had refused police protection while he was on his way to an autorickshaw driver's home for dinner.

193.title: Raveena Tandon to star in Arbaaz Khan's film 'Patna Shukla'
193.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon has been roped in for a film titled 'Patna Shukla', which will be produced by Arbaaz Khan. Speaking about the film, Arbaaz said that the upcoming social drama has all the ingredients that the Indian audience wants to watch. He added that Raveena will be seen in a "never-seen-before avatar" in 'Patna Shukla'.

194.title: BJP, Cong united to abuse me: Kejriwal on 'Modi, Modi' chants in Guj
194.article_body: After being greeted with chants of 'Modi, Modi' at Gujarat's Vadodara Airport, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that BJP and Congress are united in their aim to "abuse him". This is the reason why BJP supporters never yell anti-Rahul Gandhi slogans when the Congress leader visits Gujarat, he added. "With elections approaching…protests against...AAP are going to increase," Kejriwal stated.

195.title: Video of anchor mistaking Rahul Gandhi for KL Rahul on live TV goes viral
195.article_body: A video of an anchor mistaking Congress' Rahul Gandhi for Team India batter KL Rahul on live TV has gone viral on social media. In the video, the anchor can be heard saying, "India captain Rohit Sharma has said that Rahul Gandhi would open in T20 World Cup." Reacting to the video, a user commented, "Please fact check."

196.title: Birthday wishes to bowler who is still a mystery for many batters: Irfan to Rashid
196.article_body: Irfan Pathan took to Twitter to wish Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan on his 24th birthday and wrote, "Birthday wishes to the bowler who is still a mystery for many batters around the world. Rashid, have a good one brother." Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Enjoy your special day and have an amazing year ahead." Harbhajan Singh said, "Happy birthday Rashid, love always."

197.title: Power tariff revision won't affect the poor: TN CM Stalin
197.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday said the recent power tariff hike effected by the state government will not affect the poor. Electricity rates are still cheaper in Tamil Nadu compared to other states, Stalin said. He further blamed the previous AIADMK government's administrative negligence and debts of the state-run distribution company for the revision.

198.title: BharatPe could go public in 18-24 months: Chairman Rajnish Kumar
198.article_body: BharatPe Chairman Rajnish Kumar said the company could go public in the next 18-24 months. Speaking to CNBC-TV18, Kumar said that the company is working towards a few quarters of profitability for investor confidence in the company's plan. He added that the company's cash burn, which was $11 million per month, is down to a little above $2 million.

199.title: Uttara Kannada to get super-specialty hospital: K'taka Minister
199.article_body: Karnataka Minister of Health and Family Welfare K Sudhakar said CM Basavaraj Bommai has given approval for setting up a super-specialty hospital in Uttara Kannada district. "Location and other modalities regarding setting up the hospital will be discussed with the CM," he said. All aspects regarding healthcare infrastructure in the district were discussed with elected representatives, he added.

200.title: Uber asks India drivers to ensure rear seatbelts are functional
200.article_body: Uber asked drivers in India to ensure that rear seatbelts in their cars are functional. This comes amid a greater push for road safety, days after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry died in a car crash. "To avoid any fines or complaints by riders, please ensure the seatbelts on the back seats are accessible and functional," Uber said.

201.title: Mother Dairy expecting 20% revenue growth in FY23 to ₹15,000 cr: MD
201.article_body: Leading milk supplier Mother Dairy's MD Manish Bandlish has said the company is expecting 20% revenue growth in FY23 to about ₹15,000 crore. "We are witnessing strong demand for all...milk and...dairy products," Bandlish said. Mother Dairy's turnover stood at ₹12,500 crore in last fiscal year. Notably, the company had increased milk prices by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR in August.

202.title: After camera issue with 3rd party apps, iPhone 14 Pro users complain of 'slow' Camera app
202.article_body: After several iPhone 14 Pro users complained of camera issue while using third-party apps, several users have now complained of 'slow' Camera app. Users have suggested that the camera takes several seconds to load when the app is opened. The iOS 16.0.1 update does not appear to fix the issue for those who are impacted.

203.title: 'Cong co-owner Rahul 'glorifying hijab' through Bharat Jodo Yatra': BJP
203.article_body: BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi on Tuesday said that Congress "co-owner" Rahul Gandhi is "glorifying the hijab" through Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and accused the party of surviving on appeasement politics. 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is a "communal yatra", which is being done to save the "sinking fake Gandhis", Ravi further added.

204.title: Delhi-based developer Ajnara India goes into insolvency
204.article_body: Ajnara India has gone into insolvency after the National Company Law Tribunal on Tuesday admitted a petition filed by homebuyers. A total of 113 homebuyers filed the petition against Ajnara over default on construction of its project 'Ambrosia' and delay in possession of flats. According to UP-RERA's data, of all Ajnara projects, 99 complaints have been filed against Ambrosia alone.

205.title: Whether poor or rich, land encroachments won't be allowed: K'taka Minister
205.article_body: Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka on Tuesday said that no matter what, encroachments will be vacated in Bengaluru by the ruling BJP to avoid flood situations in future. "Whether it is poor or rich, encroachments will not be allowed to stay," he said. "The parallel facility for the poor would be made after discussing with the CM," he added.

206.title: Was concerned about 'Ponniyin...' actors' weight during pandemic: Mani
206.article_body: 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' director Mani Ratnam revealed that he was concerned about the weight of actors associated with the film during the COVID-19 pandemic. "I kept texting the actors, keeping them in check. I would be like, 'Hi, Trisha Krishnan, how are you?'," he added. The film also features actors Vikram, Karthi and actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan.

207.title: Actor Armaan Kohli, arrested over drug charges, gets bail after 1 year
207.article_body: Actor Armaan Kohli has been granted bail by the Bombay High Court in a drugs case.  A single bench of Justice NW Sambre granted bail to Kohli on a surety of ₹1 lakh. He was arrested by NCB in August last year after a small quantity of cocaine was recovered from his residence in Mumbai during a raid.

208.title: Wouldn't change him for world: Alcaraz on replacing Ferrero with Federer as coach
208.article_body: On being asked if he would be interested in appointing Roger Federer as his coach if the 20-time Grand Slam offered his services, world number one Carlos Alcaraz said, "I couldn't [replace Juan Carlos Ferrero with Federer]." He added, "I've always said that Juan Carlos is my second father, I wouldn't change him for the world."

209.title: Dalit family fined ₹60,000 after K'taka boy touches idol in temple
209.article_body: A Dalit family in Karnataka's Koppal has been imposed a ₹60,000-fine after a boy from the family entered a temple, touched the God's idol and attempted to carry it on his head. According to local residents, the incident took place when the villagers decided to celebrate the temple's construction. Miscreants are also reportedly making threat calls to the boy's mother.

210.title: Barcelona forecast $274 million profit this season
210.article_body: Barcelona have recorded a profit of $98.27 million for the 2021-22 financial year and forecast a $274 million profit for the current season, the Spanish club said. The club's board of directors closed the financial year with a turnover of $1.017 billion. Notably, Barcelona rank second on Forbes' list of football team valuations at $5 billion, behind rivals Real Madrid.

211.title: Lawyer moves Kerala HC against 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' over traffic woes
211.article_body: A lawyer has filed a petition in Kerala High Court against Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' over disruption of traffic during the march. K Vijayan wants the court to permit the yatra to occupy only one half of the road. "Rahul Gandhi and [others]...are occupying entire breadth of...road," the petition stated. Vijayan claimed the yatra violates the Kerala Public Ways Act.

212.title: Woman kills 3-yr-old daughter, dumps body in garbage pile in Maha
212.article_body: A 37-year-old woman allegedly killed her three-year-old daughter, packed her body in a plastic bag and dumped it in a pile of garbage in Maharashtra's Palghar district, police said on Tuesday. The accused later pretended that her daughter had gotten lost, an officer said. Her relatives beat her up when they found the child's body, the officer added.

213.title: 'I'm like your uncle,' texted delivery man after kissing 19-year-old at Pune home
213.article_body: A food delivery agent in Pune forcibly kissed a 19-year-old after finding her alone at home, police said. "The man...asked for water and got inside the house. When she returned, he grabbed her by the arm and kissed her twice," added police. He left as she resisted and later sent her messages saying he was "like her uncle".

214.title: I'm Hrithik's fan, would be a dream come true to meet him: Anil's lookalike
214.article_body: American bodybuilder John Effer aka Giovanni DelBiondo, who went viral for having a resemblance to actor Anil Kapoor, has said he's a huge fan of actor Hrithik Roshan. "It would be a dream come true for me to meet Hrithik! He is amazing," he added. John further said he has seen every movie of Hrithik and Shah Rukh Khan.

215.title: We did remixes way too much, went overboard with it: Amit Trivedi
215.article_body: Music composer Amit Trivedi has said that remixes are almost dead in 2022. "Whatever works, we follow it to the extent that it becomes perishable...That's what happened here (with remixes)," he added. Amit further stated that composers did remixes way too much and went overboard with it. "Now the audience is also fed up [with] it," he added.

216.title: BJP wants to dismantle our religious & Sufi traditions: Mufti
216.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti on Tuesday accused the BJP government of dismantling all religious and Sufi traditions of Kashmir to implement its divisive agenda. "Hypocrisy has no limits since BJP themselves leave no opportunity to get a turban tying ceremony done whether at a mandir, dargah, or gurdwara," she said.

217.title: German data retention law violates EU law, bloc's top court rules
217.article_body: EU's top court on Tuesday ruled that Germany's general data retention law violates the bloc's legislation. The law mandates telecom operators and internet service providers to store users' communication and location data for a specified time period. It may only be applied in circumstances involving a serious threat to national security, the Court of Justice of the European Union(CJEU) said.

218.title: There are around 2.5 million ants for every human on Earth, says new study
218.article_body: There are around 20 quadrillion (20 followed by 15 zeroes) ants living on Earth, a new study has said. This means that ants far outnumber humans, with around 2.5 million ants crawling about for every human living today. The combined biomass of all ants on Earth amounts to 12 megatons of carbon, scientists said.

219.title: Rohit Sharma equals world record for smashing most sixes in T20I cricket
219.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has equalled the world record for smashing the most number of sixes in T20I cricket. With his only six in the first T20I against Australia on Tuesday, Rohit took his tally of sixes in T20I cricket to 172. He equalled the tally of New Zealand's Martin Guptill, who has hit 172 sixes in 117 T20I innings.

220.title: Buckingham Palace shares pic of Royal Family taken 75 years ago to honour Queen
220.article_body: The Buckingham Palace shared a photograph of Royal Family taken 75 years ago, to honour Queen Elizabeth II. The late monarch is pictured with her husband, Prince Philip, at her shoulder, her sister Princess Margaret, Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother, and her father King George VI. The Queen was laid to rest at St George’s Chapel in Windsor on Monday.

221.title: Marriage not merely for sexual pleasure, its main purpose is to progenate: HC
221.article_body: The Madras High Court observed that couples who tie the marital knot must understand that marriage isn't for mere carnal pleasure, but its main purpose is to progenate. The child born out of wedlock is the connecting link between two individuals, it added. The court was hearing an application filed by a woman seeking interim custody of her two sons.

222.title: Maharashtra govt clears 181 plots for industrial projects
222.article_body: The Maharashtra government has cleared 181 plots for industrial projects in the state. The decision came after the Industry Department reviewed 191 plots, which were cleared by the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi government after June 1 this year. The present state government has been criticised after Vedanta-Foxconn chose Gujarat over Maharashtra to set up a multi-billion dollar semiconductor plant.

223.title: PCC resolutions seeking Rahul as party head not binding: Jairam Ramesh
223.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said resolutions passed by Pradesh Congress Committees (PCCs) seeking Rahul Gandhi as the party's President have "no binding effect". "Nobody asked anyone to pass any resolution...Congress party workers are enthusiastic...They've been watching Gandhi walking for past 13 days. They know the pain he is undergoing," Ramesh said. "They all can relate to him," he added.

224.title: Politics of polarisation is eroding foundation for economic well-being: Basu
224.article_body: Former Chief Economist of the World Bank Kaushik Basu said that "the politics of polarisation and division is eroding" India's foundation for economic well-being. "Over 2020-22, India's annual GDP growth is 0.43%. This places India in the middle of the world's growth table. What's worrying is that a decade ago India was in the top three," Basu said.

225.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' should have started from Guj or any BJP-ruled state: Kishor
225.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Tuesday said that Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' should have started from Gujarat where elections are due later this year or any other BJP-ruled state. Speaking after meeting activists supporting the cause of the separate Vidarbha state in Nagpur, he said, "If people have hope, then the idea of separate Vidarbha state can be pursued."

226.title: Valery Polyakov, cosmonaut who took longest single trip to space, dies at 80
226.article_body: Valery Polyakov, the Soviet cosmonaut who set the record for the longest single space stay by spending 437 days in space, died aged 80, space agency Roscosmos announced on Monday. His historic stay in space began on January 8, 1994, and continued until March 22, 1995. During this period, he orbited the Earth more than 7,000 times.

227.title: Muslim couple donates ₹1.02 crore to Andhra's Tirumala temple
227.article_body: Businessman Abdul Ghani and his wife Subeena Banu have donated ₹1.02 crore to Andhra Pradesh's Tirumala Tirupathi Devasthanam (TTD). Of the total donation, ₹15 lakh is meant for Sri Venkateswara Annaprasadam Trust, which provides free food to thousands of devotees daily. Remaining ₹87 lakh is meant for procuring furniture and articles in the kitchen of a temple guest house.

228.title: Punjab starts conjugal visits for prisoners with good behaviour
228.article_body: Punjab Prisons Department on Tuesday began conjugal visits for prisoners exhibiting good conduct. The prisoners will be able to meet their spouses for two hours once in three months and a separate room has been designated for these visits. At present, this will be allowed at Goindwal Sahib central jail, new district jail in Nabha and women's jail in Bathinda.

229.title: Drug smuggler's property on illegally-occupied land bulldozed in Ambala
229.article_body: The property of a man accused of smuggling drugs was bulldozed in Haryana's Ambala on Tuesday. Police said Praveen Kumar had occupied government land illegally.  "The construction…is being demolished by us with co-operation from city council following all legal procedures," they added. As per reports, there are many cases filed against him under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

230.title: Harassed by father out on parole, 2 sisters consume poison in UP
230.article_body: Fed up with being harassed by their father, who was out on parole, two sisters allegedly consumed poison in UP's Banda, resulting in the death of one, police said on Tuesday. The mother of the girls alleged that the accused and her brothers-in-law used to beat her and her daughters and didn't let them cook food in the house.

231.title: Japan's Kirin in talks to triple investment in Bira: Report
231.article_body: Japanese beverage company Kirin is looking to triple its investment in craft beer maker Bira, according to a report. Last year, Kirin invested $30 million for under 10% stake in the company and is looking to invest funds at an equity valuation of $450 million, Reuters reported. Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group is also looking to invest $15 million in Bira.

232.title: Starlink to seek exemption from sanctions in Iran: Elon Musk
232.article_body: Elon Musk said that SpaceX will seek for an exemption from sanctions to provide Starlink satellite internet to Iran. Musk's statement came in a response to a tweet from a science journalist saying Starlink's services could be a "real game changer for the future" of Iran. Currently, Iran is seeing protests over a woman's death in police custody.

233.title: Woman bitten by snake carried on cot across water in Chhattisgarh
233.article_body: A tribal woman bitten by a snake was carried on a cot across waist-deep water in Chhattisgarh as health officials couldn't reach her village due to heavy rainfall, officials said. At least eight villagers carried her on their shoulders across the nullah in Mungeli district. She was accompanied by another woman on the cot.

234.title: Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja share 1st pic with newborn son, name him Vayu
234.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor and her husband businessman Anand Ahuja took to social media to share the first picture with their newborn son. Revealing that they have named him Vayu Kapoor Ahuja, the couple wrote, "In Hindu scriptures Vayu is one of the paanch tatvas." "He is the incredibly powerful lord of wind," the caption read.

235.title: The sun will rise again: Bishnoi after not being selected in India's T20 WC main squad
235.article_body: India's 22-year-old leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi took to Instagram Stories to post his apparent reaction to not being selected in India's T20 World Cup 2022 main squad. He wrote, "The sun will rise again and we we will try again." Bishnoi has played 10 T20Is for India so far and has taken 16 wickets.

236.title: Alert level raised for volcano that caused largest eruption on Earth in 5,000 years
236.article_body: The alert level for a volcano below New Zealand's biggest lake was raised from zero to one on Tuesday after almost 700 small earthquakes were detected below it. The Taupo volcano caused the largest eruption on Earth in the past 5,000 years when it exploded 1,800 years ago. This is the first time that its alert level has been raised.

237.title: United Arab Emirates to launch its first lunar rover in November
237.article_body: The United Arab Emirates will launch its first lunar rover in November, the mission manager Hamad Al Marzooqi said. Named 'Rashid' after Dubai's ruler, the rover would be launched from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida aboard a Falcon 9 SpaceX rocket. "We've finished with the testing of the rover, and we are happy with the results," Marzooqi said.

238.title: Video shows 2 groups attacking each other with rods over drainage water in Pune
238.article_body: A video showing residents living in two buildings attacking each other with rods and wooden sticks has gone viral on social media. A fight allegedly broke out between the two groups over trivial issues like the release of drainage water in the parking lot and walking on the premises. The incident reportedly took place in Pune's Kirkatwadi on Tuesday.

239.title: Ensure victory to justice, not just clients: TN CM to law students
239.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Tuesday urged law students to ensure victory to justice and not confine to the success of their clients. Speaking at the silver jubilee of Dr Ambedkar Law University in Chennai, he said, "You should serve as messengers of justice. Utilise [your] legal acumen and debating skills to provide justice to the poor and downtrodden."

240.title: Gujarati film Chhello Show beats 'The Kashmir...', 'RRR'; selected as India's Oscar entry
240.article_body: Gujarati film 'Chhello Show' has been chosen as India's submission to the Best International Feature Film category at the 95th Academy Awards. 'Chhello Show', which is titled 'Last Film Show' in English, has been directed by Pan Nalin. 'The Kashmir Files' and 'RRR' were reportedly some of the movies under consideration.

241.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st T20I against Australia
241.article_body: Australia captain Aaron Finch won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the first T20I in Mohali. India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah and wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant do not feature in the playing XI. Meanwhile, Axar Patel and Yuzvendra Chahal are India's two spinners for the match. Further, Umesh Yadav is playing a T20I after three years.

242.title: 1,032 hectares of ganja cultivation destroyed in a major operation in Himachal
242.article_body: The officers of the Central Bureau of Narcotics have destroyed 1,032 hectares of illicit cannabis (ganja) cultivation in Himachal Pradesh in one of the biggest destruction operations. During the operation conducted over two weeks, officers climbed daily up to 11,000 feet above sea level and even camped in sensitive areas. Drones were used for the detection and surveillance of cannabis.

243.title: When I do a Hindi film, I hope it's memorable for people: Dulquer
243.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has said that he has grown up watching Hindi cinema, however, Dulquer added that he wants to do unique films in Hindi. "I come a little sporadically...there's always a gap. Whenever I do a film in Hindi, I hope it is memorable for the audience," he added. Dulquer made his Bollywood debut with the 2018 film 'Karwaan'.

244.title: Lies: Kejriwal on Mann being deplaned in Germany for being drunk
244.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday defended Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann amid allegations that he was deplaned in Germany for being "drunk". "The Opposition is slinging mud at Mann and spreading lies, as they cannot find a fault in his work," Kejriwal said. Will look into the allegations, said Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia.

245.title: 18-yr-old girl dies after being run over by train in UP
245.article_body: An 18-year-old girl died after she was run over by a goods train at Bharwari Railway Station in Kaushambi, UP. The incident took place when the deceased, Rinki, was crossing the railway line, an official said. Notably, Rinki's father, Ramvishal, works in the engineering department of the Bharwari Railway Station. The goods train was going towards Kanpur, the official added.

246.title: Akram told Arshdeep 'Sardarji, you are bowling very well': Jaswant Rai
246.article_body: Revealing Arshdeep Singh and his idol Wasim Akram's conversation during recently concluded Asia Cup, India pacer's childhood coach Jaswant Rai said, "Arshdeep told me that he met Akram bhai who told him, 'Sardarji, you are bowling very well. You are a good bowler'." Rai added that Akram told Arshdeep, "If you think you are perfect, then don't come to me."

247.title: 105 ATM burglaries reported since October 2018: Delhi Police
247.article_body: Delhi Police has recorded 105 cases of ATM burglary from October 2018 to August 31 this year. Of these, 52 cases have not yet been solved. Senior officials said robbers are now increasingly finding it easier to target unmanned ATMs in remote areas compared to bank robberies. The last bank robbery in Delhi was in October 2018.

248.title: Raj govt paid unemployment allowance to 6.04 lakh youths since 2019: Minister
248.article_body: The Rajasthan government has provided unemployment allowance to about 6.04 lakh youths under the 'Mukhyamantri Yuva Sambal Yojana' since February 2019, Minister of State for Skill Development and Entrepreneurship Ashok Chandna said. Only 29,000 applications are pending, he added. Speaking in Assembly, Chandna said that more than 1.57 lakh unemployed youths were getting the allowance at present.

249.title: Coming week, it'll be surreal being student again: Twinkle on master's degree
249.article_body: Author Twinkle Khanna is all set to start a master's course at University of London. She took to Instagram on Tuesday and wrote, "It took almost two years to plan all...logistics but I'm finally going back to university to do my Master's in Life and Creative writing." "It'll be surreal, this coming week, being...student again, scribbling down notes," Twinkle added.

250.title: Kherson to hold vote on joining Russia: Moscow-installed official
250.article_body: The Russian-installed administration of Ukraine's Kherson region on Tuesday said it has decided to hold a referendum on the region's accession to Russia. We have urged Kremlin to approve the vote at the earliest, the region's Moscow-appointed head Vladimir Saldo informed. Saldo added that he hoped Kherson would become "a part of Russia, a fully-fledged subject of a united country".

251.title: Hyderabad Income Tax Principal Commissioner transferred to Mumbai
251.article_body: Vasundhara Sinha, the Principal Commissioner of Income Tax, Hyderabad, has been transferred to Mumbai. This comes amid Income Tax raids across Telangana in connection with the alleged Delhi liquor policy scam. Sinha is a 1988 batch Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officer. She is the wife of Anjani Kumar, the Director General of the Anti-Corruption Bureau.

252.title: SRK danced in 'Happy New Year' rehearsals with dislocated shoulder: Choreographer
252.article_body: Choreographer Vrushali Chavan revealed Shah Rukh Khan had a dislocated shoulder and an injured knee during the rehearsals of his 2014 film 'Happy New Year'. She said Shah Rukh was walking with the help of a crutch. "When I was teaching him, he would dance like there is no tomorrow...this was during the rehearsals, not even the shoot," Vrushali added.

253.title: Old bridge at Pune's Chandni Chowk likely to be demolished on Sept 25
253.article_body: The old bridge at Chandni Chowk in Pune is likely to be demolished on September 25 (Sunday). Since it's the weekend, there will be less traffic on the Katraj to Dehu road bypass highway and other connecting roads to the chowk. At present, the pre-demolition work is underway and it will be completed by Friday.

254.title: Transport sector key cause of PM2.5, CO emissions in Pune: Report
254.article_body: According to the Emission Inventory Report, the transport sector contributes up to 20% of the emission load of PM2.5 and up to 61% of the emission load of carbon monoxide in Pune. Industries contribute 19% of PM2.5 emission and up to 18% of carbon monoxide emission followed by residential areas at 8% and agricultural waste burning at 5%.

255.title: Delhi govt to start pre-budget planning from October last week
255.article_body: Delhi government will start its pre-budget planning from the last week of October this year. As part of preparations, the Finance Department has sent a proforma to all the departments concerned where they can input data of the revised budget estimates for 2022-23 and estimates for the 2023-24 financial year. The submission must be made on or before October 10.

256.title: Pune residents to move Bombay HC over bad condition of roads
256.article_body: Residents of Pune's Wagholi area have decided to approach the Bombay High Court after allegedly getting no response from authorities to repair damaged roads in the locality. "This dilapidated condition has resulted in several traffic mishaps in the past," a resident said. The Wagholi Housing Societies Association will file a PIL.

257.title: BJP has always cheated youths in the name of employment: Tejashwi
257.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav has criticised the BJP for allegedly not providing adequate employment to the youths. "BJP, which runs the business of lies and hatred, has always cheated the youths of the country and the state in the name of jobs and employment," Yadav said. He added, "Today 4,325 newly appointed revenue employees will be given appointment letters."

258.title: Michelin star chef Garima to join Vikas, Ranveer in 'MasterChef...': Reports
258.article_body: Michelin star chef Garima Arora is set to join 'MasterChef India 7' as a judge, as per reports. The 36-year-old chef is the first Indian woman to win a Michelin star. This is the first time that the show will have a female chef as a judge. Vikas Khanna and Ranveer Brar will also return as judges on the show.

259.title: Delhi boy wins Collins National Spelling Bee with word 'dialysis'
259.article_body: A Delhi boy, Madhav Kamath, has won the recently concluded Collins National Spelling Bee 2022 with the word 'dialysis'. Thousands of students participated in the competition which took place in Mumbai and the top 36 scorers reached the semi-final, out of which 12 competed against each other in the finale. The winner studies at Delhi's Sanskriti School.

260.title: Lies: Pawar on Maha govt's claims that Vedanta project moved to Guj under MVA
260.article_body: NCP leader Ajit Pawar said Maharashtra government's claims that Vedanta-Foxconn decided to move their plant to Gujarat under Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government's rule are "complete lies". Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis also claimed that a "10% commission" had to be paid under MVA for every subsidy that was announced. "Let [BJP] probe, then things will be clear," Pawar added.

261.title: Man kills self after harassment over repayment of loan in Pune
261.article_body: A 52-year-old man allegedly ended his life on Monday after money lenders harassed him over the repayment of a loan in Pune. The deceased man's wife filed a complaint against seven persons, alleging that they charged exorbitant interest rates, harassed and threatened her husband. Meanwhile, police have booked seven persons under abetment to suicide and arrested four of them.

262.title: Poisoning young minds: BJP on Mufti's remark against hymn in school
262.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir BJP president Ravinder Raina on Tuesday accused Mehbooba Mufti of "poisoning young minds for vested political interests" over her objection to students reciting the 'Raghupati Raghav Raja Ram' in schools in J&K. Mufti is coming out with such a conspiracy to regain her place after having lost her ground in J&K, Raina added.

263.title: Man sued in US for tipping waitress ₹2.3 lakh and then demanding it back
263.article_body: A US man is being sued by Pennsylvania's Alfredo's Pizza Cafe after he tipped a waitress $3,000 (₹2.3 lakh) and later demanded it back. He had challenged the tip with his credit card provider. The restaurant first assumed it was a miscommunication and made attempts to contact him but was unsuccessful. It later filed charges, describing the incident as "aggravating".

264.title: I don't drink or do drugs, but fame has intoxication: Ashneer on Shark Tank
264.article_body: BharatPe's former MD Ashneer Grover while speaking about appearing as a judge on Shark Tank India, said, "I don't do drugs, I don't drink, I don't smoke. But fame has an intoxication. It gives you a high." He added, "And that...I can manage and I like." He also claimed that all the sharks came on the show to get famous.

265.title: Education should be in mother tongue: Minister Dharmendra Pradhan
265.article_body: Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Monday stated that education should be imparted in one's mother tongue. Calling Tamil a national language, he added that the inclusion of Tamil in National Education Policy (NEP) would gradually gain support. He said that Tamil Nadu, which has a great heritage in education, will continue to lead the way in the framework of NEP.

266.title: Pro League will be helpful to prepare ourselves for hockey World Cup: Mandeep
266.article_body: Indian men's hockey team forward Mandeep Singh said the FIH Pro League, beginning October 28, will be helpful for the team to prepare for World Cup 2023. "It's always good to compete against strong teams before a major competition," he added. The World Cup is set to take place in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela from January 13 to 29, 2023.

267.title: 30% of Bharat Yatris are women; You're seeing new face of Cong: Jairam
267.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said that 30% of the "Yatris" in the ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' are "women". "You're seeing a new face of the Congress. They are coming from different states," Ramesh said. He added, "Over 2 lakh people have registered...The Yatra is a tapasya for Rahul [Gandhi] Ji and public response has been in the form of bhakti."

268.title: Contractor to give ₹5 lakh aide to Noida wall collapse victims' relatives
268.article_body: The family members of the four labourers, who died after a boundary wall of a Noida housing society collapsed, will be provided ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh each by the contractor, Noida Authority Chief Executive Officer Ritu Maheshwari said. Eight labourers were injured in the incident. Meanwhile, police detained a sub-contractor who supplied the labourers to repair drain in the society.

269.title: India to grow at over 7% in FY23, down from 8% projected in Jan: CEA
269.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran on Tuesday said the Indian economy will grow at 7% in FY23, down from the 8-8.5% growth rate projected in January. He said the aftereffects of the COVID-19 pandemic and Russia's invasion of Ukraine are hurting economic growth. India is well-poised to sustain the 7% growth rate for remainder of the decade, he added.

270.title: 2 held for robbing man in Thane, using his credit cards to shop online
270.article_body: Thane Police arrested two persons for allegedly robbing a man of his belongings and using his credit cards to purchase items worth ₹1.6 lakh online, an official said. The incident took place on August 2 when the victim was going home and the accused threw spice powder at him and snatched his four mobile phones and credit cards, police said.

271.title: B'luru civic body extends application deadline for free laptops, housing subsidy
271.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has extended the last date to apply for welfare programmes, including a subsidy of ₹5 lakh for house construction on own plots, free laptops for students, smart sticks for blind persons, educational laptops for blind students and foldable wheelchairs for senior citizens to October 19. The original deadline to apply for the schemes was September 19.

272.title: US court reverses conviction of man in ex-girlfriend's murder case
272.article_body: A US court on Monday reversed the conviction of a man who had been serving a life sentence since 2000 for the murder of his ex-girlfriend. The state attorney of Baltimore City last week asked the court to vacate Adnan Syed's conviction. The prosecution cited discovery of new information and unreliability of incriminating evidence as the reason behind the move.

273.title: 'India won't give any more financial aid to Sri Lanka,' say reports, embassy responds
273.article_body: The Indian embassy in Sri Lanka issued a response after reports said the Indian government will not extend any more financial assistance to Colombo amid an economic crisis. "India has extended unprecedented bilateral assistance amounting close to $4 billion," said the embassy. India is supporting Sri Lanka by promoting long-term investments, scholarships to Lankan students, etc, the embassy added.

274.title: BJP misusing agencies to harass minorities: Ex-Cong MLA Asif Khan
274.article_body: After the arrest of AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan, ex-Delhi Congress MLA Asif Khan alleged the BJP is "misusing" its agencies to "harass" minorities. "I am...against the misuse of agencies, particularly against minorities, by the BJP government," Asif Khan said. Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Branch on Friday arrested Amanatullah Khan in connection with a corruption case involving the Delhi Waqf Board.

275.title: Donate money, not flowers and shawls: Mumbai's Haji Ali Dargah
275.article_body: Trustee of Mumbai's Haji Ali Dargah has appealed to the devotees to donate money instead of flowers and shawls. Many devotees get duped as stale flowers and shawls of substandard quality are sold to them at higher prices, we don't want them to waste their money, trustee Suhail Khandwani said. He added the shrine is undergoing renovation and needs money.

276.title: 2 more arrested for murder of Suresh Raina's uncle & cousin in 2020
276.article_body: Two more people have been arrested from Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar for their involvement in the murder of cricketer Suresh Raina's 58-year-old uncle and a cousin during a robbery bid in Punjab's Pathankot in August 2020. Raina's uncle was a contractor by profession. Three accused were arrested a month after the incident took place.

277.title: What an experience: Ananya Panday on Ranbir Kapoor's 'Brahmastra'
277.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to Instagram Stories and reviewed Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra'. "What an experience! Fully in love with this world and everyone in it," she wrote. Ananya added that she's "embarrassingly" late to watch the film and urged her fans to watch it. "Whoever is down to discuss fan theories message me," Ananya further wrote.

278.title: AAP gave liquor contract to its candidate Karanjit: BJP's Gaurav Bhatia
278.article_body: The BJP alleged that the AAP government ignored all the rules and gave the liquor contract to its candidate, Karanjit Singh Lamba. "It has become clear from the sting operation how Arvind Kejriwal makes a recovery. How they earn black money and how people are looted...AAP gave liquor licence to Kejriwal's close aide," said BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia.

279.title: WB school students protest at railway station over teachers' transfer
279.article_body: Hundreds of students of a school in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas on Tuesday staged a protest on railway tracks over the transfer of their teachers without notice. "We want our message to reach teachers so we are protesting on rail tracks," the students said. Rail traffic at Gourdaha halt railway station in Canning was affected due to the protest.

280.title: 54,810 Russian soldiers killed, 2,216 tanks destroyed so far: Ukraine
280.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday claimed that it has killed around 54,810 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. As per Ukraine's Foreign Ministry, its forces have destroyed 2,216 Russian tanks and over 460 aircraft, including 217 helicopters. The ministry said that 4,724 armoured personnel carriers, 1,323 artillery systems and 318 Multiple Launch Rocket Systems have also been destroyed.

281.title: Only she can explain: Saugata Roy on Bengal CM's remark on PM Modi
281.article_body: Reacting to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's "PM not misusing central agencies" statement, TMC MP Saugata Roy claimed that only Mamata Banerjee can explain the political significance of her statement. "The resolution was passed yesterday in the Assembly in which it is said that the CBI and ED are being misused," Roy said.

282.title: Fintech industry should engage more with govt: FM Sitharaman
282.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the financial technology industry should have more engagements with the government and its agencies across all levels. "The greater the engagement, the greater the trust which gets built up," Sitharaman said. She also added that there are also opportunities for fintech players to play a role in the sustainable financial environment.

283.title: Maha govt ends freeze on MIDC's 181 projects amid Vedanta controversy
283.article_body: The Eknath Shinde government has ended freeze on the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation's (MIDC) allotment of 181 land parcels, an official said. Decisions over remaining 10 are also expected soon. The projects were sanctioned by the previous Uddhav Thackeray government. This development comes at a time when the government is facing criticism for a Vedanta project going to Gujarat.

284.title: Armenia, Azerbaijan leaders meet in NY after deadly border clashes
284.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken hosted foreign ministers of Armenia and Azerbaijan, Ararat Mirzoyan and Jeyhun Bayramov, in New York. This was the first direct talks between leaders of the two countries since over 170 soldiers were killed in the recent border clashes. Mirzoyan called for "international mechanisms to prevent further escalations", Armenian Foreign Ministry said in a statement.

285.title: Online gaming platform WinZO sues Google over 'unfair' Play Store policy
285.article_body: WinZO has filed a lawsuit in Delhi HC to stop Google from allowing daily fantasy sports, or real-money games for fantasy sports and rummy, on its Play Store app under a pilot project. WinZO said Google's policy excludes a large sector of real-money games, classified as skill-based games, making it "unfair". "[The move will] distort the market," WinZO added.

286.title: Over 90 airports in India to be carbon-neutral by 2024: Union Minister
286.article_body: Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said over 90 airports in the country will be carbon-neutral by 2024. "In last eight years, number of airports in the country has increased from 74 to 141...this will grow up to 220 in next five years," Scindia added. Currently, the country has 141 airports, of which Kochi and Delhi airports are carbon-neutral, he stated.

287.title: Body of a man found in luggage compartment of Mumbai local train
287.article_body: A body of an unidentified man was found in the luggage compartment of Mumbai's local train at Panvel Railway Station on Tuesday. The deceased is in the age group of 35-40 and his body was spotted by a passenger, police said. The local train where the body was found came from Kurla and was leaving for Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus.

288.title: Moody's withdraws Kalyan Jewellers' rating after fundraise delay
288.article_body: After Kalyan Jewellers India postponed its plans to access the international debt capital markets, rating agency Moody's on Monday withdrew the firm's stable B2 long-term corporate family rating. In April, the company was reportedly planning to raise around $200 million through its subsidiary. Kalyan reported consolidated revenues of ₹10,820 crore and core profit of around ₹850 crore for FY22.

289.title: IAS Shah Faesal withdraws SC plea challenging Article 370 revocation
289.article_body: IAS officer Shah Faesal has withdrawn his petition from the Supreme Court challenging the revocation of Article 370, which granted special status to Jammu and Kashmir, according to a report. This comes months after Faesal was reinstated in the service earlier this year and appointed Deputy Secretary in the Ministry of Culture. He had quit the government service in 2019.

290.title: Bilkis Bano case witness writes to CJI, says convict told him 'I am out now'
290.article_body: A witness in Bilkis Bano case has written to CJI UU Lalit alleging threats from a convict and expressing fear for his life. Imtiaz Ghanchi said convict Radheshyam Shah purportedly told him, "What did you get by calling me an accused, I'm out now" and laughed. Eleven men convicted for gang-rape and murder in the case were freed last month.

291.title: CWG gold was best moment of my life, playing with Sharath was amazing: Sreeja
291.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sreeja Akula said winning the gold medal in mixed doubles with partner  Sharath Kamal at Commonwealth Games 2022 was the "best moment" of her life. "Playing with Sharath was an amazing experience. He guided me really well during the match," she added. "I'm very happy that I did really well in my maiden Games," Sreeja stated.

292.title: Cong appoints Yuri Alemao as legislature party leader in Goa Assembly
292.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday appointed Yuri Alemao as the leader of its legislature party in the Goa Assembly. This comes days after eight Congress MLAs including Digambar Kamat, Michael Lobo, Delilah Lobo, Kedar Naik, Rajesh Faldessai, Sankalp Amonkar, Rodolfo Fernandes and Aleixo Sequeira joined the BJP. Alemao will lead the legislature party that now consists of three MLAs.

293.title: 14 sperm whales die in mass stranding on Australian beach
293.article_body: At least 14 young sperm whales have died in a mass stranding on a beach in Tasmania in Australia. The whale carcasses were discovered on King Island on Monday afternoon, Tasmania's Department of Natural Resources and Environment said. The incident comes two years after more than 380 pilot whales died on Tasmania's west coast in Australia's worst mass stranding.

294.title: CBI files chargesheet against Yes Bank Co-founder in bank fraud case
294.article_body: The CBI reportedly filed a chargesheet against Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor and Avantha Group Promoter Gautam Thapar in a ₹466.51-crore bank fraud case. Kapoor was not named in the June 2021 FIR, however, his role surfaced during subsequent probes. CBI alleged that the accused had committed criminal breach of trust and conspiracy to divert public money during 2017-2019 period.

295.title: Don't know of anyone who knows Salman but doesn’t like him: Ali Abbas
295.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar has said that he misses working with actor Salman Khan. "I don't know of anyone who knows Salman Khan but doesn't like him," he added. Ali has worked with Salman in 'Sultan', 'Tiger Zinda Hai' and 'Bharat'. "If Salman doesn't like you, he will tell you 'today, I don't like you'," Ali further stated.

296.title: Was changing my niece's dirty diaper when I got a call for 'Avatar': Zoe
296.article_body: Actress Zoe Saldana has revealed that she was changing her niece's dirty diaper when she was offered 'Avatar'. "I can't forget getting that phone call from Jim (James Cameron, director) saying, 'I want you to play Neytiri'," Zoe said, adding, "I've never enjoyed a dirty diaper as much as I enjoyed changing that diaper, when I was on...phone with Jim."

297.title: One farmer dying every hour under BJP rule: Congress
297.article_body: The Congress on Tuesday held BJP-led central government's policies responsible for farmers' suicides in the country. "Every day 30 farmers are dying by suicide and every hour more than one farmer is dying," Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said while citing NCRB data. This comes after a Pune-based farmer died by suicide over not getting the Minimum Support Price (MSP).

298.title: 50-yr-old labourer killed, wife injured in leopard attack in Gujarat
298.article_body: A 50-year-old labourer from Maharashtra died while his wife was seriously injured after they were attacked by a leopard in Gujarat’s Junagadh on Tuesday, forest officials said. "The man sustained injuries on his neck...and that proved fatal," The Indian Express quoted an official as saying. The incident occurred when the labourer and his wife were asleep in a sanatorium.

299.title: Odisha government increases Dearness Allowance for employees
299.article_body: As a festive gift, Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik approved the proposal to increase the Dearness Allowance (DA) by three percent for the state government employees. "Dearness relief for pensioners drawing on a revised rate has also been increased by three percent," the Chief Minister's Office said. The move will benefit nearly four lakh government employees.

300.title: 17 Guj students say teachers call them home for domestic work, run away
300.article_body: Seventeen girl students of Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya in Gujarat ran away from school on Sunday after complaining that two teachers were forcing them to come home and do their domestic work. "We have received complaints from class eight students that two teachers are calling them to their homes...even to take care of their children," the school's head teacher said.

301.title: Ukraine using Russian tanks abandoned during counteroffensive: Think tank
301.article_body: Ukraine is deploying left-behind Russian T-72 tanks as it pushes into occupied region of Luhansk, a Washington-based think tank, Institute for the Study of War said. "The initial panic of the counteroffensive led Russian troops to abandon higher-quality equipment in working order," the institute added. Ukraine launched counteroffensive into territory around the second largest city of Kharkiv.

302.title: Will look into it: Aviation Minister on Punjab CM being deplaned for 'being drunk'
302.article_body: Reacting to reports that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann was deplaned in Germany's Frankfurt allegedly for being drunk, Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said, "I will certainly look into it." He said, "The incident took place on international soil. We'll have to make sure that we verify the facts." It was up to Lufthansa airline to provide the data, Scindia added.

303.title: Let's not talk about this: Mani Ratnam on question about Vairamuthu
303.article_body: Director Mani Ratnam, during an event, refused to answer a question regarding lyricist Vairamuthu. When asked how he felt about Vairamuthu not being a part of 'Ponniyin Selvan', Ratnam replied, "Let's not talk about this now." Vairamuthu, who was initially a part of the film, was dropped after he was called out in the MeToo movement by singer Chinmayi Sripaada.

304.title: Gauri Khan only turns up when she is not invited: Bhavana Pandey
304.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Bhavana Pandey has stated that Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan only turns up to events if she is not invited. "If you invite her she's like, 'Oh God, it's too boring, I don't want to come'," Bhavana added. She further said her daughter actress Ananya Panday is "extremely sensitive and very empathic".

305.title: Tries to make everything controversial: BJP on Mufti's 'Hindutva agenda' remark
305.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir BJP leader Kavinder Gupta criticised PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti over her 'Hindutva agenda' comment, saying she tries to make everything controversial. "May the PDP leader be blessed with good thoughts," Gupta said. This comes after Mufti shared a video of Kashmiri students singing 'Raghupati Raghav Raja Ram' hymn and accused the BJP of propagating its Hindutva agenda.

306.title: We were stopped by govt from protesting outside UP Assembly: Akhilesh
306.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said his party was stopped by the government from holding a protest outside the UP Assembly on Monday. Yadav and other party leaders took out a march against the UP government yesterday. "When the government didn’t allow us to protest in the Assembly, then the SP decided the path of streets," Yadav added.

307.title: Tonga volcano erupts 8 times in 2 days; releases molten lava
307.article_body: A volcano north of Tonga's main island has erupted eight times in the last two days, the country's geological service said, warning mariners to keep their distance from the area on Tuesday. The Home Reef volcano, which began erupting on September 10, has been oozing molten lava and shooting steam and ash at least three kilometres into the air.

308.title: Boycott B'wood is necessary, 90% of industry is corrupt: Faissal Khan
308.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's brother Faissal Khan said that Boycott Bollywood is a necessary movement, adding that "all the evils of Bollywood" came to light after Sushant Singh Rajput's death. "The world got to know the dirty side of Bollywood. And how much arrogance is there in the industry," he added. Faissal further said that 90% of the industry is corrupt.

309.title: Definition of dignity has changed with time: SC in Karnataka hijab matter
309.article_body: Senior advocate Dushyant Dave, representing petitioners challenging Karnataka High Court's judgement on hijab, told Supreme Court that hijab adds to dignity and makes a woman very dignified when she wears it, like a Hindu woman who covers her head, it's dignified. A bench comprising Justices Hemant Gupta and Sudhanshu Dhulia told Dave that definition of dignity has changed with time.

310.title: All lions at Hyd zoo are healthy: Officials as visitor raises concern
310.article_body: After a Twitter user pointed out the "poor health" of lions at Nehru Zoological Park in Hyderabad, officials said all the 20 lions are healthy except two which are under treatment. "The misleading statement is strongly condemned," an official statement said. The Twitter user had said that he found the lions at Nehru Park to be extremely sick.

311.title: Follow 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Prayas': PM to BJP Mayors
311.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday directed BJP Mayors to follow the motto of "Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas and Sabka Prayas". "It's the responsibility of...Mayors to work from the grassroots level," he added. He called for decentralisation of urban planning. The PM also urged the Mayors to follow the path of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, who was also a Mayor.

312.title: US woman who faked her kidnapping sentenced to 18 months in jail
312.article_body: The 39-year-old California woman who faked her own kidnapping in 2016 has been sentenced to 18 months in prison. Sherri Papini had claimed she was abducted by two Hispanic women, while authorities later found that she had been living with her ex-boyfriend. Papini will have to pay $309,902 in restitution for losses incurred by several agencies, including the FBI.

313.title: Portugal-bound Ryanair flight unexpectedly lands 400 km away in Spain
313.article_body: A passenger took to Twitter after a Ryanair flight from Dublin-Portugal unexpectedly landed 400 km away in Malaga, Spain. Passengers reportedly didn't realise they were in the wrong country until after they landed. While the airline sent one bus to transport the passengers, it said that the re-route took place due to a strike by French Air Traffic Control.

314.title: TV actor Shalin Bhanot to be part of 'Bigg Boss 16': Report
314.article_body: Television actor Shalin Bhanot has reportedly agreed to participate in 'Bigg Boss 16', which will premiere on October 1. As per the report, Bhanot is "excited" to be part of the new season of the reality show. Apart from Bhanot, celebrities such as Kanika Mann, Arjun Bijlani, Munawar Faruqui and others have also been reportedly approached for the show.

315.title: Arvind Kejriwal greeted with chants of 'Modi-Modi' in Gujarat
315.article_body: AAP National Convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal was greeted with chants of 'Modi, Modi' after he arrived at the Vadodara airport in Gujarat. In a video that surfaced online, Kejriwal could be seen smiling while moving towards the media persons after hearing the chants of PM Narendra Modi's name. Notably, Kejriwal is on a day-long visit to poll-bound Gujarat.

316.title: Over 30,000 illegal foreigners deported till August 31: Assam minister
316.article_body: Over 30,000 illegal foreigners have so far been deported from the state based on the Assam Accord. Atul Bora, the Assam Accord Implementation Minister, informed the state Assembly on Monday that 1,48,022 illegal foreigners have been detected in the state till August 31. As many as 31,953 infiltrators had entered India before March 25, 1971, and 1,16,069 had come after.

317.title: Pulse polio booths at Delhi Metro stations to be operational till Sept 23
317.article_body: The Pulse polio booths which have been set up at selected metro stations in Delhi will be operational till September 23. The booths remain open from 8 am to 2 pm and 2 pm to 8 pm. The booths are set up at metro stations like Tis Hazari, Kashmere Gate, Seelampur, Shastri Park, Pul Bangash, Pratap Nagar, etc.

318.title: 21-yr-old delivery agent beaten with belt over parking dispute in Guj
318.article_body: A security guard of a residential society allegedly thrashed a 21-year-old pizza delivery boy in Gujarat's Ahmedabad with a belt over a parking dispute. The victim asked the guards to help him remove a scooter that was parked in front of his vehicle, following which one of the guards took his belt out and beat him.

319.title: Denied cigarette, tourist fires shots inside Shimla restaurant; arrested
319.article_body: A tourist was arrested for allegedly firing gunshots inside a restaurant in Shimla on Tuesday morning. The man, identified as Vishwanath, allegedly threatened to kill a waiter and fired rounds in air after the latter refused to bring him food and cigarette citing closing of business hours. Vishwanath was booked under Sections 336 and 506 of IPC and Arms Act.

320.title: Husband, 3 others arrested for woman's murder outside Panvel railway station
320.article_body: Husband of the 29-year-old woman whose throat was slit outside Panvel railway station last week has been arrested with his girlfriend, her employer and a contract killer. The man reportedly had an extramarital affair and married his girlfriend in August. When his wife learnt about this, he and the other two accused allegedly hired people to kill her.

321.title: Palestinian security forces and gunmen clash in West Bank; 1 dead
321.article_body: A 53-year-old man on Tuesday was killed in clashes between Palestinian gunmen and Palestinian Authority's security forces in the West Bank, as per medics. The violence reportedly erupted after the arrest of two militants, one of whom Hamas claims is its senior member wanted by Israel. Militant organisation Hamas is the rival of Fatah that controls the Palestinian Authority.

322.title: India great emerging market, best bet in global economy: Ashok Hinduja
322.article_body: Hinduja Group Chairman Ashok Hinduja called India "the very great emerging, fast-moving market" and said it is the "best bet" in the global economy. "We see a recession coming in the US...UK, Europe, problems in China...we focus now (on) India," he said. He further said India is politically well settled as PM Narendra Modi has handled international relations well.

323.title: Was told I'll never be an actress if I only do item songs: Gauahar Khan
323.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan stated in an interview that she was told when she started out that she will never be an actress if she doesn't star opposite a big actor or only does item songs. "I just hope I can keep defying every kind of stereotype...I've been fighting these things throughout my career," the actress added.

324.title: Several areas of Pune to face water cuts on Thursday: Authorities
324.article_body: The water supply in several parts of Pune will remain shut off on Thursday due to maintenance and other civil works in the municipal water centres, the authorities informed. The areas which will be affected include Peth areas, Deccan, Shivajinagar, Sahakar Nagar, parts of Kondhwa, Kalas and Tingre Nagar. The supply will be restored in the affected areas on Friday.

325.title: Mumbai Airport witnesses passenger movement of 1,30,374 in 1 day
325.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport witnessed a record passenger movement of 1,30,374 on September 17, reports said. Nearly 95,080 passengers travelled through Terminal 2 (T2) and 35,294 via Terminal 1 (T1) of the airport on September 17. A total of 839 flight movements were recorded on this day, according to reports.

326.title: Satellite pics show massive crowds at Queen Elizabeth's funeral in London
326.article_body: Satellite images over London on Monday showed massive crowds that lined streets to see Queen Elizabeth II's funeral procession. Thousands of people were seen lining the streets and the areas along the procession route shortly after the Queen's coffin left Westminster Hall for Windsor Castle, where she was laid to rest. The Queen was laid to rest alongside her family.

327.title: Shefali Shah honoured with Italy's Alberto Sordi Family Awards
327.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has been honoured with the Alberto Sordi Family Award which honours Italian and international figures close to the thought of actor-director Alberto Sordi. Shefali shared pictures from the event on social media, writing, "This year among the recipients is me. What can I say except that I am shocked, extremely humbled and thankful...truly unbelievable."

328.title: People sell daughters to free those caught selling hooch: BJP MP
328.article_body: Bhopal BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur has alleged that people in three of the villages she has adopted are forced to sell their daughters to free those caught selling illicit liquor for a living. Her statement invited sharp criticism from Congress, which said it reflected the ground reality under the BJP's 'Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao' campaign.

329.title: Exposing Hindutva agenda in J&K: Mufti on students singing Ram Dhun
329.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti shared a video of Kashmiri students singing 'Raghupati Raghav Raja Ram' and accused the BJP-led Central government of propagating its Hindutva agenda in J&K. BJP leader Kavinder Gupta said that Mufti has been trying to mislead the public regarding the bhajan 'Raghupati Raghav Raja Ram' being sung in a school in Kashmir.

330.title: Tier 2 and tier 3 cities can also be centres of economic activity: PM Modi
330.article_body: PM Narendra Modi called for creating economic opportunities in tier two and tier three cities to make them centres of economic activity to ease the pressure on bigger cities. "Most of the startups now are being set up in tier two and tier three cities...We should also increase industrial clusters in such places," said PM Modi.

331.title: Uganda declares Ebola outbreak after rare Sudan strain found
331.article_body: Uganda has declared Ebola outbreak after authorities confirmed a case of rare Sudan strain, health ministry and the World Health Organization said. A 24-year-old man developed high fever, diarrhoea, abdominal pain and was vomiting blood before he died, a health official said. There are currently eight suspected cases of Ebola receiving care in a health facility, WHO's Africa office said.

332.title: Hero Group, KKR to invest $450 million in Hero Future Energies
332.article_body: American private equity firm KKR and Hero Group have agreed to invest $450 million in Hero Future Energies (HFE). HFE plans to expand the renewable energy capacity, reduce carbon emissions by 1 billion tonnes by 2030 and achieve net-zero emissions by 2070. Founded in 2012, HFE has a diversified portfolio of 1.6 GW of operating solar and wind projects.

333.title: It's an interesting character, I learnt beatboxing: Tamannaah on 'Babli...'
333.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia has said she learnt how to ride a bullet for her upcoming movie 'Babli Bouncer'. She added she also learnt beatboxing. "Babli is an interesting character," said Tamannaah. The film, directed by Madhur Bhandarkar, will feature Tamannaah as a female bouncer. 'Babli Bouncer' is all set to release on September 23 on an OTT platform.

334.title: Supreme Court upholds validity of Haryana Sikh Gurudwara Act
334.article_body: The Supreme Court has upheld the constitutional validity of the Haryana Sikh Gurdwara (Management) Act, 2014, under which a separate committee was formed to manage the affairs of gurdwaras in the state. The bench dismissed the plea filed by a member of the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee seeking quashing of the Haryana Sikh Gurdwara Act.

335.title: Leaders must tackle conflicts, climate crisis, poverty, inequality: UN chief
335.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned that the world is in "great peril" and urged leaders to tackle conflicts, climate catastrophes, increasing poverty and inequality. He said leaders should address divisions among major powers that have become worse since Russia invaded Ukraine. Guterres will deliver "state of the world" speech at the 77th United Nations General Assembly in New York.

336.title: Manjrekar opts out of film on Savarkar, Randeep Hooda to direct: Reports
336.article_body: Director Mahesh Manjrekar has reportedly opted out of the film based on the life of Veer Savarkar. According to reports, actor Randeep Hooda will now direct the upcoming biopic in addition to playing the lead role in it. The film, titled 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar', will reportedly go on the floors next week in Maharashtra.

337.title: When you dance with SRK, you feel like film's heroine: Vrushali Chavan
337.article_body: Choreographer-actress Vrushali Chavan said she fell in love with actor Shah Rukh Khan after working with him. "When you rehearse with him, you feel like you are the heroine of the film. And he will give you the sweetest kiss on your forehead," she added. Vrushali said that Shah Rukh never takes advantage of his position and follows orders.

338.title: Priyanka Gandhi to join Bharat Jodo Yatra in Kerala: Jairam Ramesh
338.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Tuesday said that the party's General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will join the Bharat Jodo Yatra in Kerala. "We have completed 275 km of Bharat Jodo Yatra," added Ramesh in Alappuzha. The foot march, which aims to cover 3,570 km from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir in 150 days, was launched on September 7.

339.title: World Bank approves loan worth $150 million for Punjab
339.article_body: The World Bank's Board of Executive Directors on Monday approved a loan worth $150 million (over ₹1,195 crore) for Punjab to help the state better manage its financial resources and improve access to public services. The agency's Country Director in India, Auguste Tano Kouame, said that the World Bank is "pleased to be a partner of the state of Punjab".

340.title: Can Fin Homes shares fall 6% a day after MD & CEO Kousgi resigns
340.article_body: The shares of mortgage lender Can Fin Homes declined up to 6% in early trade on Tuesday, a day after its Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer Girish Kousgi resigned citing personal reasons. At 11 am, its stock was trading at ₹575.9 apiece on the BSE. Its stock had hit a two-month low of ₹571.2 on August 22.

341.title: Tamil Nadu woman refuses to rent out flat to Scheduled Caste man, booked
341.article_body: A woman was booked for allegedly refusing to rent out a flat to a man belonging to Scheduled Caste. The woman reportedly said that she would not rent the flat to any Muslim, Christian or Scheduled Caste/ Scheduled Tribe person as it would offend her family deity. Members of a Dalit political party said that she would be punished.

342.title: Bengaluru doctor posts fiancee's nude pics on social media, killed; 3 arrested
342.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a 27-year-old architect, Prathibha, and her two male friends on charges of murdering her live-in partner and fiance, Dr N Vikas, for allegedly uploading her nude photos on social media. Police said Prathibha found that Vikas uploaded photos of her and her mother using a fake ID. Police said Dr Vikas worked at a private hospital.

343.title: BJP, PM don't need validation from Mamata: Amit Malviya
343.article_body: Reacting to Mamata Banerjee's statement that she does not believe that PM Narendra Modi is misusing central agencies, BJP IT Cell head Amit Malviya said that no one in BJP, and most certainly the PM, needs any validation from her. "Her entire govt, top ministers...immediate family is under the radar of central agencies, because the courts ordered investigation," he added.

344.title: 38-yr-old Mumbai man held for stealing 27 bicycles worth ₹2.6 lakh
344.article_body:
A 38-year-old resident of Dharavi, Raes Tavar Khan, has been arrested for allegedly stealing 27 bicycles worth ₹2.6 lakh from Mumbai's Bandra, Khar, Shivaji Park and Lamington Road areas.
"We intercepted Khan as we found his movements to be suspicious," police said. "We suspect...some of the stolen bicycles belong to...Dabbawalas, who are an integral part of the city," police added.

345.title: PepsiCo ends Pepsi, 7UP and Mountain Dew production in Russia
345.article_body: PepsiCo has stopped producing Pepsi, 7UP and Mountain Dew in Russia nearly six months after it said it would suspend sales and production over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "All concentrates have subsequently been exhausted in Russia and production has ended," a PepsiCo spokesperson said. The spokesperson added that this was "in line with the announcement we made in March".

346.title: Matrimonial ad asks software engineers to 'not call'; social media users react
346.article_body: After a matrimonial ad asked software engineers to "not call", a Twitter user wrote, "Can Mechanical engineers call." Sharing the undated newspaper ad, the founder of Helios Capital, Samir Arora wrote, "Future of IT does not look so sound." "Don't worry...Engineers don't rely on some newspaper ad. They find everything on their own," another user wrote.

347.title: Ranbir & I are not 'two bodies one soul' kind of people: Alia Bhatt
347.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that she and her husband Ranbir Kapoor are strong individuals. "We both respect our individual personalities and professional commitments together. We're not do jism ek jaan (two bodies one soul) kind of people," she added. Alia stated they have a "beautiful" relationship as companions and have a better working relationship as they're passionate about films.

348.title: Assam passes Bill with penal provisions for pvt educational institutions
348.article_body: Assam Legislative Assembly on Monday passed the Assam Non-Government Educational Institutions (Regulation of Fees) (Amendment) Bill, 2022. The Bill includes penal measures against private institutions that do not comply with the provisions of the Fee Regulation Act. The non-government educational institutions have been asked to file applications before the Fee Regulatory Committee by October 31.

349.title: Man flashes his private part at minor girl in Navi Mumbai; booked
349.article_body: Police have booked an unidentified person for allegedly flashing his private part at a girl while asking for an address in Navi Mumbai's Vashi. According to police, the accused man had also offered her to sit on his motorbike to help him in locating the address, which the girl refused. "We...are checking the CCTV footage...to trace the accused," police said.

350.title: Don’t fall prey to fake website selling plots near Noida airport: YEIDA
