350.article_body: A fake website called yamunaawasiyabhukhand.in is allegedly offering residential plots near the Noida airport site, Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) CEO Arunvir Singh has warned in a notice. The website is misusing YEIDA's main project details and its master plan. It reportedly pretends to provide inexpensive apartments close to the airport to deceive unwary investors.

351.title: Environmentalist dies by suicide over corruption in PDS in K'taka
351.article_body: A 68-year-old environmentalist allegedly died by suicide over corruption in Public Distribution System (PDS) in Karnataka's Davanagere district on Tuesday. Veerachari had earlier claimed that food items in PDS shops were not being distributed to marginalised sections of society and pledged to end his life if justice wasn't delivered. Following the incident, local residents staged a protest.

352.title: Israel appoints ambassador to Turkey for first time since 2018
352.article_body: Israel on Monday announced the appointment of Irit Lillian as its new ambassador to Turkey. Lillian is the first person to hold the post since 2018. Turkey withdrew its ambassador from Israel and ordered Israel's ambassador to leave the country in 2018 over the killing of dozens of Palestinians by Israeli forces during border protests along the Gaza border.

353.title: Sub-contractor detained after boundary wall collapse in Noida kills 4
353.article_body: Hours after a portion of a Noida housing society's boundary wall collapsed on Tuesday, police have detained the sub-contractor who supplied labourers for repairing a drain there. Eight people were injured in the incident that took place at Jal Vayu Vihar in Noida Sector 21. All 12 labourers were buried under the rubble.

354.title: He needs to improve: Indian men's wrestling coach on Ravi's World C'ships loss
354.article_body: Indian men's wrestling coach Sujeet Maan said that Ravi Dahiya needs to improve after the Olympic silver medallist's loss to Uzbekistan's Gulomjon Abdullaev in the 57-kg category pre-quarterfinal at the recently concluded World Wrestling Championships. "He (Ravi) knows he has to improve and there is certainly no one more disappointed with his performance than he himself is," he added.

355.title: CPI MP writes to President, says 'Kerala Governor's actions unconstitutional'
355.article_body: CPI MP Binoy Viswam has written a letter to President Droupadi Murmu accusing the Kerala Governor of having an open collision with the state government and called his actions anti-constitutional. "The Governor has stated that he was not inclined to give assent to the bills passed by the Assembly...He is sworn to preserve, protect and defend the Constitution," said Viswam.

356.title: T'gana man stabbed with injection after offering lift to stranger; dies later
356.article_body: A 46-year-old man in Telangana's Khammam died on Monday after an unidentified man allegedly stabbed him with an injection after seeking a lift on the deceased's two-wheeler. The suspect escaped from the scene after administering the injection, police said. The deceased sought help from people nearby, complaining of giddiness. He soon fainted and was taken to a hospital.

357.title: Over 40 lakes disappeared in Bengaluru since 1963: Karnataka minister
357.article_body: During a debate about floods in Karnataka, state Revenue Minister R Ashoka told the Karnataka Assembly that over 40 lakes have disappeared in Bengaluru since 1963. Buildings and layouts have been built on levelled lakes in areas like Rajajinagar and Dollars Colony, he added. He alleged that most of the encroachments on lakes happened during the tenure of Congress government.

358.title: Building collapses, fire incidents are major concern in cities: PM
358.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the collapse of old buildings and incidents of buildings catching fire in cities are a major concern. "This can be avoided if rules are followed," he added while addressing BJP mayors' conference. His remarks come on a day when a building wall in a Noida residential complex came down, killing four workers.

359.title: 4 nations including Poland turn away Russian tourists over Ukraine war
359.article_body: Poland, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania have begun turning away Russian tourists, saying they should not enter while their country is at war with Ukraine. Finland has reduced consular appointments for Russian travellers seeking visas. The ban excludes Russian dissidents seeking refuge. The European Union has banned all flights from Russia, keeping only rail and road transport links operational.

360.title: IIT Bombay girl student filmed inside hostel bathroom by canteen worker
360.article_body: A canteen worker at IIT Bombay was arrested for recording a video of a girl student while she was in the hostel bathroom, students of the institute have alleged. The student noticed the accused's phone looming outside the bathroom window, filming her, and alerted the hostel council and authorities. The worker had allegedly climbed pipes to peep inside the bathroom.

361.title: Stopped from making reels, UP woman tries to strangle her brothers
361.article_body: Police have registered a case against a young woman after she attempted to strangulate her two younger brothers when they stopped her from making video reels in UP's Farrukhabad, according to a report. She even allegedly assaulted women police constables and tore their uniform. Her brother reportedly said she had an addiction of making reels and uploading them on Instagram.

362.title: Bridge left twisted, cracked after strong earthquake in Taiwan; video surfaces
362.article_body: A strong 6.8 magnitude earthquake that hit southeastern Taiwan on Sunday left the Gaoliao Bridge twisted and cracked. Since Saturday evening, dozens of earthquakes have hit the island's southeastern coast. The earthquakes also toppled a three-story building and knocked a part of a passenger train off its tracks.

363.title: Jet Airways warns job applicants of fake interviews, issues statement
363.article_body: Ahead of its relaunch, Jet Airways issued a statement in reference to its job applications. The airline said that some people impersonating Jet Airways employees are demanding money in exchange for interviews or jobs at the airline. "Jet Airways does not solicit any payment for any recruitment," it added. It further asked applicants to check the source of job postings.

364.title: 31 students fall sick after eating dinner at Telangana school
364.article_body: As many as 31 students fell sick after eating dinner at a minority residential school in Telangana's Kumuram Bheem Asifabad district on Monday. They were rushed to a hospital, where their condition was said to be stable. Some students complained that they were getting low-quality food for the past three days and that they even found insects in the food.

365.title: Cash crunch due to wrong vastu, will shut Hyd Bus Bhavan south gate: TSRTC
365.article_body: Authorities of Telangana State Road Transport Corporation said the corporation faced financial loss possibly due to wrong vastu alignment. Accordingly, they're planning to shut the south entry gate of Hyderabad's Bus Bhavan and open an east-facing gate that they believe "aligns well with vastu shastra and will bring better luck". The east symbolises life and brings light, an official said.

366.title: Rana Daggubati snatches fan's phone over selfie at Tirupati temple
366.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati recently visited the Tirupati temple along with his wife Miheeka Bajaj and his father D Suresh Babu. A video going viral on social media shows a fan trying to pose with Rana for a selfie when Rana snatches his phone. The actor can then be seen returning the fan's phone and saying, "No selfies in a temple."

367.title: 2 tribal women tonsured after panchayat finds them guilty of abetting suicide
367.article_body: A panchayat in Telangana's Nalgonda allegedly forcefully tonsured two tribal women after charging them with abetting the suicide of a 16-year-old of the same community. The two women were tied to a tree, reportedly abused and beaten up by villagers on Saturday, police officials said. The panchayat allegedly issued a diktat that police shouldn't be informed about the incident.

368.title: PFI leader arrested over RSS worker's murder in Kerala
368.article_body: A PFI leader, Aboobaker Siddik, has been arrested for killing an RSS worker in Kerala’s Palakkad district. He was apprehended on Monday for allegedly conspiring and hiding the culprits involved in the murder. "He is the 23rd accused in the Srinivasan murder case who has been arrested...He was taken into custody from his house," said the investigating officer.

369.title: 2 killed, 3 injured after lightning strikes shop in Chhattisgarh
369.article_body: Two men died and three other people were injured after lightning struck them in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur district on Monday evening. According to a police official, the deceased, identified as Nandlal Paikra and Sanjay Yadav, had taken shelter at a shop below a tree after it started raining. Suddenly lightning struck there, killing Paikra and Yadav on the spot, he added.

370.title: Ex-Meta executives' startup TrueFoundry raises $2.3 mn in seed round
370.article_body: US-based machine learning startup TrueFoundry has secured $2.3 million in a seed funding round led by Sequoia India and Surge. AngelList Talent Co-founder Naval Ravikant and Eniac Ventures participated in the round. TrueFoundry was co-founded by ex-Meta executives Nikunj Bajaj, Abhishek Choudhary and angel investor Anuraag Gutgutia. Angel investors include Deutsche India CEO, Dilip Khandelwal.

371.title: Auto driver, 4 others arrested for robbing 2 men at knifepoint in Mumbai
371.article_body: The Kurar Police arrested an auto driver and four others for allegedly robbing two men at knifepoint in Malad East, Mumbai. The accused were identified as Akash Shinde, Ganesh Anil Raje, Mahesh Kamble, Sunny Ghode and Ram Raje. The victims, Deenbandhu Das and Kallan Dulai, were waiting to hire an auto outside a restaurant when the incident happened, police said.

372.title: Have directed strict action: Thakur on players being served food kept in toilet
372.article_body: Reacting to the video of food kept in a toilet being served to kabaddi players in UP's Saharanpur, Union Sports Minister Anurag Thakur said that he has directed strict action against the accused contractor and officers. "I have also directed that the contractor be blacklisted for the future," he added. The district sports officer was suspended after the incident.

373.title: UK-US trade deal could be years away: British PM Liz Truss
373.article_body: The UK may not strike a free trade deal with the US for years, British PM Liz Truss said ahead of her first bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden in New York. Truss said she was more focused on obtaining accession to the Trans-Pacific trade partnership and striking trade deals with India and the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC).

374.title: Maroon 5's Adam Levine accused of cheating on wife, Instagram model shares alleged DMs
374.article_body: 'Maroon 5' singer Adam Levine has been accused of cheating on his wife Behati Prinsloo by an Instagram influencer. Sumner Stroh released a TikTok video alleging she and Levine were having an affair. She shared screenshots of DMs allegedly from Levine, where they appeared to flirt, and a text from him asking if he could name his child after her.

375.title: Delhi HC proceeds ex-parte against Vivek Agnihotri in 2018 contempt case
375.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday proceeded ex-parte against filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri, scientist Anand Ranganathan, and magazine and news portal Swarajya in connection with a 2018 contempt case. This comes after the three failed to appear or send their representatives to court. The case was filed over their criticism of Justice S Muralidhar for granting bail to Urban Naxal Gautam Navlakha.

376.title: Two drunk Army men create ruckus at Bengaluru airport, arrested
376.article_body: Two Army men were arrested for allegedly assaulting on-duty security personnel at Bengaluru airport in an inebriated condition, reports said. The accused were trying to drive in a lane designated for VIPs and CISF personnel when they were stopped, reports added. They were attending a party near Bengaluru and went to the airport to sober up, reports further said.

377.title: Tiger Global-backed Zopper raises $75 mn in Series C funding round
377.article_body: Insurtech startup Zopper on Tuesday said it has raised $75 million in a Series C funding round led by Creaegis, which also saw participation from ICICI Venture and Bessemer Venture Partners, and existing investor Blume Ventures. Co-founded by Surjendu Kuila and Mayank Gupta in 2011, the company said that Tiger Global will continue to extend its support for future growth.

378.title: Alia Bhatt receives Smita Patil Memorial Award for Best Actor
378.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has been felicitated with Priyadarshni Academy's Smita Patil Memorial Award for Best Actor. She was felicitated virtually by Union Ministers on Monday for her "outstanding and critically acclaimed performances in Hindi films". "India has the most incredible legacy of the arts and I'm eternally grateful that our work is a part of it," the actress said.

379.title: Very excited: Anees Bazmee on his action-comedy after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
379.article_body: Director Anees Bazmee on Tuesday announced that he will be helming a "larger-than-life" action-comedy, which he promises to be a film that "the Indian audiences have never seen before". "After the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', I want to give our audiences an even bigger dose of entertainment," he said, adding that he's "very excited" about the upcoming project.

380.title: Water supply to be affected in parts of Thane on Wednesday
380.article_body: The Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) announced that a 12-hour water cut will be enforced in some parts of Thane on Wednesday (September 21). The water supply will be cut from 9 am to 9 pm to carry out maintenance work at Pise filtration plant. The strainer at the plant is clogged with silt and garbage after being flooded, TMC said.

381.title: Who are the most expensive buys of the first-ever SA20 auction?
381.article_body: Batter Tristan Stubbs is the most expensive buy of the first-ever SA20 auction, being bought by Sunrisers Eastern Cape for Rand 9.2 million. Batter Rilee Rossouw, bought by Pretoria Capitals for Rand 6.9 million, is the second-most expensive buy. He is followed by Marco Jansen (Sunrisers Eastern Cape, Rand 6.1 million) and Wayne Parnell (Pretoria Capitals, Rand 5.6 million)

382.title: Never date 2 boys at same time: Gauri on her dating advice to Suhana
382.article_body: Talking about the dating advice she would give her daughter Suhana Khan, Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan said, "Never date two boys at the same time." Gauri made this remark during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7'. Discussing the film title she would use to describe her love story with SRK, Gauri stated, "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge".

383.title: BYJU'S financial results 2nd blockbuster release of 2022 after Brahmāstra: Co-founder
383.article_body: BYJU'S Co-founder Divya Gokulnath claimed the edtech startup's financial results are "second blockbuster release" of 2022, after Brahmāstra. BYJU'S, which reported its results after 18-month delay, said losses for FY21 stood at ₹4,500 crore. Accusing media of "sensationalism", Gokulnath said, "It's easy [to] forget...we're 18 months post FY21, and...BYJU'S has grown over 4 times in this span."

384.title: Porn videos of young girls being sold on Twitter for ₹20: DCW chief Swati Maliwal
384.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women's Chairperson Swati Maliwal has claimed that porn videos of young girls are being sold on Twitter for ₹20-30. She tweeted, "Twitter has become a medium for selling pornographic videos of children. Videos of rape of young girls are flooded on Twitter." She said she has summoned Twitter India policy head and Delhi Police over the issue.

385.title: Officer suspended after Kabaddi players served food kept in toilet
385.article_body: A district sports officer in UP's Saharanpur, Animesh Saxena, has been suspended after reports of food kept in a toilet being served to Kabaddi players surfaced. The players had claimed that they were given half-cooked rice for lunch and when they complained, the cook placed rice in the toilet. A probe was ordered into the incident by the state government.

386.title: Deepika Padukone should play Amrita in Brahmāstra 2: Alia Bhatt
386.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that she sees Deepika Padukone as the character Amrita in 'Brahmāstra: Part Two – Dev'. "She is gorgeous and stunning. She has that amazing stature," Alia added. Actor Ranbir Kapoor stated that Dev and Amrita are the most interesting characters in the trilogy, adding that it will be exciting for any actor to play the characters.

387.title: Huge BJP protest in Jaipur after over 50,000 cows died due to lumpy skin disease in Raj
387.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party on Tuesday staged a protest in Jaipur in connection with lumpy skin disease that has killed over 50,000 cattle in Rajasthan. Reports said the protestors clashed with police and broke barricades. They also raised slogans. Meanwhile, a BJP legislator, on Monday, brought a cow outside state Assembly to draw government attention towards the disease.

388.title: Prime suspect in TMC leader Bhadu Sheikh’s murder arrested by CBI
388.article_body: The CBI has arrested Sona Sheikh, who is one of the key suspects in TMC leader Bhadu Sheikh’s murder. He was arrested from Suri town in Birbhum and has been sent to CBI custody for four days. Earlier in March, a mob allegedly comprised of Bhadu’s associates had set 10 houses on fire, killing eight, including women and children.

389.title: Leaving out Pant in T20 WC 2022 will be the best thing: Wasim Jaffer
389.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said leaving out Rishabh Pant in the T20 World Cup 2022 will be the "best thing". Jaffer added that Pant's best role in the lineup would be that of an opener which he doesn't consider as a viable option. Jaffer stated that India should leave out Pant and pick Dinesh Karthik and Axar Patel instead.

390.title: Indonesia passes data privacy law that punishes leaks with 6-year jail term
390.article_body: Indonesian Parliament has passed a data protection bill that includes corporate fines and up to six years of imprisonment for those found mishandling data. The bill has been passed after data leaks and alleged breaches like a contact-tracing COVID-19 application that revealed President Joko Widodo's vaccine records. The fine includes 2% of a corporation's annual revenue and confiscation of assets.

391.title: DMK Deputy General Secretary Subbulakshmi Jagadeesan quits politics
391.article_body: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) Deputy General Secretary Subbulakshmi Jagadeesan on Tuesday announced her resignation from the party and also from politics. "I submitted my resignation to party president MK Stalin on August 29. I am quitting the DMK and also from active politics," she said. Jagadeesan was Union Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment from 2004 to 2009.

392.title: Tunisia's anti-terrorism police detain former PM Laarayedh: Lawyers
392.article_body: Tunisia's anti-terrorism police have detained former Prime Minister and Opposition party Ennahda's senior official Ali Laarayedh for one day, lawyers said. According to lawyers, Laarayedh was detained after an investigation into suspicions of sending terrorists to Syria. Ennahda has denied accusations of terrorism, calling it a political attack on Tunisian President Kais Saied's foe.

393.title: Don't touch foreigners: Chinese official advice to avoid monkeypox
393.article_body: A top Chinese health official has warned citizens against touching foreigners and recent returnees from abroad after mainland China confirmed its first case of monkeypox. "It is necessary and very important to strengthen the surveillance and prevention of monkeypox epidemic at the social level," Wu Zunyou, chief epidemiologist at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention, said.

394.title: 3 police constables suspended in Pune history-sheeter attack case
394.article_body: The Pune police on Monday suspended three police constables for dereliction of duty in the case of history-sheeter Tushar Hambir's attack at Sassoon General Hospital earlier this month. The three constables were allegedly deployed for the security detail but were not present when the attack took place. The constables were suspended following a preliminary investigation into the same.

395.title: Korean actor Tae-oh enlists in military, to complete service in 2024
395.article_body: Korean actor Kang Tae-oh enlisted in the military on September 20. On Monday, the actor took to Instagram to thank his fans for their love and support. He said he will return after completing his military service, which is expected to end in 2024. Reportedly, Tae-ho will reprise his role of Lee Jun-ho in the sequel of 'Extraordinary Attorney Woo'.

396.title: Ex-Twitter CEO Dorsey to be questioned in Twitter-Musk lawsuit today
396.article_body: Former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey will be questioned under oath today in Twitter's lawsuit against Elon Musk, court filings showed. Dorsey will be questioned by attorneys from both sides via Zoom. He had been subpoenaed last month by Musk seeking documents and communications about Twitter's use of mDAU, a measure of active users on its platform.

397.title: Will restore old pension scheme if elected to power in Gujarat: Rahul Gandhi
397.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday assured that if Congress is elected to power in Gujarat, then it will restore the old pension scheme, like in Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh. "By abolishing the old pension...BJP has made the elderly dependent from self-reliant," he tweeted. Earlier, thousands of retired government employees in Gujarat held protests demanding re-introduction of the old scheme.

398.title: B'luru doctor murdered for uploading nudes of live-in partner on social media
398.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a 27-year-old architect and two of her friends on charges of murdering her live-in partner for allegedly uploading her private photos on social media. Both Vikas and Prathibha were in a relationship and lived together. Prathibha recently discovered that Vikas uploaded her and her mother's photographs on social media using a fake ID, police said.

399.title: I was broke for most of my dating life, a girl gave me ₹5,000 monthly: Vijay
399.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma has revealed that most of his dating life happened when he was "broke", adding that it is "very tragic". The actor further said that paying bills on dates would become awkward and there were girls who were violently against him paying. "This girl...used to give me ₹5,000 or something like that monthly," the actor added.

400.title: Metro network in India now reached 775 km from less than 250 km in 2014: PM
400.article_body: Till 2014, metro network in the country was less than 250 kilometres long but today it is more than 775 kilometres, PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday. PM Modi was addressing the Council of Mayors and Deputy Mayors of BJP in Gandhinagar, Gujarat via video conferencing. Furthermore, he said, "Tier-2 and tier-3 cities are now becoming centre of economic activities."

401.title: 35-yr-old driver found dead in Gurugram, neighbour booked for murder
401.article_body: A 35-year-old man, who worked as a driver at a private company, was found dead in bushes in a parking lot in Gurugram's Sector 33, police said. The man's neighbour was booked for the murder after his family alleged that he was killed over personal enmity. "Our neighbour [suspected] that his wife eloped with my son," the victim's father said.

402.title: 2 killed as powerful earthquake hits Mexico for 3rd time on same date
402.article_body: A magnitude 7.6 earthquake struck western Mexico on Monday, as the country was marking the anniversaries of two major quakes that had struck Mexico on the same date in 1985 and 2017. At least two people have been killed so far. One person was crushed by the facade of a department store while another was found dead at a mall.
